text: Paolo Cabras (16 January 1931 â€“ 2 July 2020) was an Italian politician and surgeon. He was born in Rome. He was first elected to the Chamber of Deputies in 1972. Cabras remained a deputy until 1987, when he was elected to the Senate. He retired in 1994. He was a member of the Christian Democracy Party. Cabras died on 2 July 2020 in Rome, aged 89. ==References== Category:1931 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Italian physicians Category:Politicians from Rome
title: Paolo Cabras
